title: Shooting Aftermath Leaves Homeland Security Department in Turmoil
summary: As officials point fingers in the wake of Alex Pretti’s death at the hands of federal agents, concerns grow about the agency’s future.

title: Trump and Schumer Move Toward Possible Deal to Avert a Shutdown
summary: The president and the top Senate Democrat were discussing an agreement to split off homeland security funding from a broader spending package and negotiate new limits on immigration agents.

title: Judge in Minnesota Says ICE Has Violated Nearly 100 Court Orders
summary: A federal judge said ICE had disobeyed more judicial directives this month than “some federal agencies have violated in their entire existence.”

title: F.B.I. Agents Search Georgia Election Center
summary: F.B.I. agents searched a Fulton County, Ga., election center for ballots from 2020, escalating an investigation of a heavily Democratic jurisdiction the president has criticized over his defeat.

title: Another Top Kennedy Center Official Resigns
summary: Kevin Couch, who was announced as senior vice president of artistic programming less than two weeks ago, is the latest to leave since President Trump took control of the center last year.

title: Homelessness Appears to Decline, Reversing a Yearslong Trend
summary: The Trump administration has not yet released the count, which could complicate its plans for tough new policies.

title: Why the NORAD Cold War Pact Between the U.S. and Canada Is News
summary: The State Department clarified comments made by the U.S. Ambassador to Canada that NORAD would be “altered” if that country did not purchase American F-35 jets.

title: At World’s Busiest Port, China’s Unbalanced Economy Comes Into View
summary: The shipping traffic and factories never stop in China’s port city of Ningbo, but the local housing market has crashed and nearby restaurants sit empty.

title: U.K.’s Starmer Meets Xi Jinping in Beijing as Ties Warm
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain met with President Xi Jinping of China as he sought to promote business ties with the world’s second-largest economy.

title: Rubio Says Venezuela Will Submit Monthly Budget to White House

title: Who Will Win the Best Actor Oscar?
summary: In an exceptionally strong field, Timothée Chalamet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Ethan Hawke, Michael B. Jordan and Wagner Moura each have a way to triumph.

title: Trump Threatens Iran With ‘Massive Armada’ and Presses a Set of Demands
summary: U.S. and European officials say they have put three demands in front of the Iranians, including a permanent end to all enrichment of uranium.

title: Man Sentenced to 15 Years for Role in Plot to Kill Iranian Dissident
summary: Carlisle Rivera became the third person to be sentenced for playing a role in trying to kill Masih Alinejad, an activist and a critic of the Iranian government.

title: How His Duel With Trump Boosted Emmanuel Macron, France’s Embattled President
summary: Dismissed as a lame duck, Emmanuel Macron has clawed back some influence after his defense of Greenland and Denmark. Will quieter domestic politics allow him to secure his legacy?

title: She Couldn’t Defend Herself, But He Wasn’t Charged With Rape
summary: A decision not to charge a man who fathered children with a woman with a mental illness has set off a debate about rape, consent and China’s push for babies.

summary: The tech giant is spending $35 million to promote its film about the first lady, far more than is typical for documentaries.

title: South Africa Cancels Release of ‘Melania’ Documentary

title: Tens of Thousands in Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana Without Power After Storm
summary: Across Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana, hundreds of power lines and poles remained damaged after freezing rain and low temperatures coated much of the region in ice over the weekend.

title: Sergey Brin Spends $20 Million on California Political Effort Amid Wealth Tax Debate

summary: After working and camping for a week on Thwaites Glacier, scientists were ready to start drilling into the ice, if only the weather would let them.

title: No Child Deserves to Die Like My Daughter
summary: What was done to my daughter did not break me. It left me with a mother’s responsibility to ensure no child is left unheard.

summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said the only way to close a more than $12 billion budget gap was to raise taxes on the wealthy and corporations.

title: Victim in School Sex Abuse Case Wins $30 Million Jury Award
